Comment:
!!! All values have maximum of 255 !!! Guard A = Halbardier; Bleu = Blue/Silver Guard B = Lancer Jaune = Yellow Soldier A = Swordsmen Orange = Orange Soldier B = Foot Knight Rouge = Red Officer B0 = normal Officer Noir = Black Officer = Special Officer Vert = Green Knight0 = Mounted Knight Vert Mechant = Green Enemies
HP = Health Points; Officer Value is Only Set for Officers and Special Officers Decreasing with Increasing Tier; Officers and Special Officers of Same Tier have same value Guard Value is 1 for Halbardiers and Lancers and 0 for everything else Ranged Attack Rate = Higher number equals more attacks per minute; 0 makes ranged units unable to fire Melee Attack Damage scales weird -> Blue Halbardier deals 5 damage on his default value and between 9-19 with 255 Melee Attack Rate: Gravitr said that's what that value is for, but didnt see it working in Testing Weapon: String representation of their Weapon or something similar I guess, 'SD' for normal units 'VP' for enemy Heroes. HL -> Halbardier; SW -> Sword; BW -> Bow; etc. Bitflags: 11xx 0yyz -> x what x is needs to be tested; y is 1 for Mounted Knights and 0 for everything else; z is 0 for ally and 1 for enemies Ranged Value = 2 for Merry Men Bow guys in Forrest Missions; 3 for Archers; 4 for Crossbowmen Mounted Knight Value = 3 for Mounted Knights, 10 for Enemy Heroes and 64 for everything else (Maybe Should be Renamed) 1 and 2 -> Needs to be Tested, Values goes Up as Units get better 3 -> Needs to be Tested, Always 0 for Both Guard Types, Ranged and Soldier A; Always 0 for all Allies; Value Going up with increasing Tier 4 -> Needs to be Tested, 2 for Knight0, Soldier B and the Merry Man, 1 for Officers and Officer B0's and 0 for everything Else Response_Purse -> Needs to be Tested, Value goes down as Units get better: Only Applied to Guard B, Soldier A and Archers: Rest and all Allies is 0 (Response to Purse) Response_Apple -> Needs to be Tested, Value goes down as Units get better: Only Applied to Soldier A, Soldier B, Knight0 and Crossbow: Rest and all Allies is 0 (Response to Apple) Response_Beer -> Needs to be Tested, Value goes down as Units get better: Only Applied to Guards, Crossbowmen and Officers; Rest and all Allies is 0 (Response to Beer) Response_Whistle -> Needs to be Tested, Value goes down as Units get better: Only Applied to Guard B, Soldier A, Archers, Officers and Knight0; Rest and all Allies is 0 (Response to Whistle) 9 -> 11: Merry Man Staff Guy 12: Lancer 13: Archers(Merry Man Included) 14: Halbardier 15: Swordsmen 16: Officers 17: Foot Knights 18: Mounted Knights 19: Crossbowmen Green Enemies: 21-27 (No Mounted Knights) 10 -> Needs to be Tested, 3 for Guards; 2 for Knight0, Soldier B and Scathlock; 1 for Soldier A, Officers, Guiy of Guisbourne, Longchamp and Sheriff; 0 for all Ranged and Both Merry Man Types 11 -> Needs to be Tested, 2 for Knight0, Soldier B, Guard A and Guy of Guisbourne; 1 for Soldier A, Officers, Crossbowmen and Scathlock, 0 for Guard B, Archers, Longchamp and Sheriff 12 -> Needs to be Tested, Weirdest Field of them All, maybe another Bitflag Field, couldn't figure anything out Guards, Soldiers, Knight0, Archer and Crossbow have the Same Value for 'normal' enemies, and extra value for Green Enemies and Green Allies; Black Officers have a diffrent Value than other Officers all together
